org.netbeans.spi.search.provider

Class SearchProvider.Presenter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.netbeans.spi.search.provider.SearchProvider.Presenter
  • Enclosing class:
    SearchProvider

    public abstract static class SearchProvider.Presenter
extends Object
    Presenter for search provider. This class is used to show panel and start the search task.

    Example:

     
 class ExampleSearchPresenter
       extends BasicSearchProvider.Presenter {

   BasicSearchForm form = null;
   private boolean replacing;

   public ExampleSearchPresenter(boolean replacing) {
       this.replacing = replacing;
   }

   public JComponent getForm() {
       if (form == null) {
           form = new Form(); // create a new with UI for specifying search settings
           form.setName("Example Provider");
       }
       return form;
   }

   public SearchComposition<Def> composeSearch() {
       // here create a new search composition appropriate for settings 
       // specified in the form.
   }

   public boolean isUsable() {
       return form.isUsable();
   }

   public void addUsabilityChangeListener(ChangeListener cl) {
       form.setUsabilityChangeListener(cl);
   }

   public void clean() {
       super.clean();
       form.clean();
   }    
 }

    • Constructor Detail

      • Presenter

        protected Presenter(SearchProvider searchProvider,
                    boolean replacing)
        Constructor for subclasses.
        Parameters:
        searchProvider - Provider this instance is created for.
        replacing - True if the presenter should be shown in replace dialog, false if it should be shown in find dialog.

    • Method Detail

      • getForm

        @NonNull
public abstract JComponent getForm()
        Return a JComponent that contains controls for setting search options. It will be shown as a tab in search dialog. All invocations of this method on this object should return the same object. You should update inner state of this presenter from the component, or store reference to created component in this presenter, so that the current settings can be obtained from the form when a new search is started, i.e. when composeSearch() is called.

      • composeSearch

        @NonNull
public abstract SearchComposition<?> composeSearch()
        Performs search considering current settings in the panel that was returned by getForm()
        Returns:
        A new search composition.

      • isUsable

        public abstract boolean isUsable(@NonNull
                                 NotificationLineSupport notificationLineSupport)
        Test that the current settings specified in associated form are usable for searching.
        Parameters:
        notificationLineSupport - You can set warning, info or error message shown in the dialog using this object. If you set warning or error messages, call NotificationLineSupport.clearMessages() before this method returns true.
        Returns:
        True if search can start with the current settings, false otherwise.

      • addChangeListener

        public final void addChangeListener(@NullAllowed
                                    ChangeListener changeListener)
        Adds a ChangeListener to the listener list. The same listener object may be added more than once, and will be called as many times as it is added. If listener is null, no exception is thrown and no action is taken.
        Parameters:
        changeListener - the ChangeListener to be added.

      • removeChangeListener

        public final void removeChangeListener(@NullAllowed
                                       ChangeListener listener)
        Removes a ChangeListener from the listener list. If listener was added more than once, it will be notified one less time after being removed. If listener is null, or was never added, no exception is thrown and no action is taken.
        Parameters:
        listener - the ChangeListener to be removed.

      • fireChange

        protected final void fireChange()
        Fires a change event to all registered listeners.

      • hasListeners

        public final boolean hasListeners()
        Checks if there are any listeners registered to thisChangeSupport.
        Returns:
        true if there are one or more listeners for the given property, false otherwise.

      • clean

        public void clean()
        Method called when the dialog is closed. It should release allocated resources. The default implementation does nothing.

      • getSearchProvider

        public final SearchProvider getSearchProvider()
        Get associated search provider.
        Returns:
        Provider this presenter was created for.

      • isReplacing

        public final boolean isReplacing()
        Get replace mode.
        Returns:
        True if the presenter should be shown in replace dialog, false if it should be shown if find dialog.

      • getHelpCtx

        @CheckForNull
public HelpCtx getHelpCtx()
        Get help ID for this type of search. Can return null if it is not available.
